data.title: Sony Music Entertainment
data.meta_description: Sony Music Entertainment | 1,107,121 followers on LinkedIn. We fuel the creative journey. | At Sony Music Entertainment, we fuel the creative journey. We‚Äôve played a pioneering role in music history, from the first-ever music label to the invention of the flat disc record. We‚Äôve nurtured some of music‚Äôs most iconic artists and produced some of the most influential recordings of all time.
data.text:
Setting the summer vibes right at the TAG Summer Block Party! ‚òÄÔ∏è üé∂ All of our Talent Advisory Groups (TAGs) in the U.S. came together on the rooftop of our NYC office to mingle and network with peers while enjoying light bites and a live performance by KATIE. #LifeatSonyMusic

#YourVoiceYourPowerYourVote is coming back for the U.S. elections. In partnership with Asian and Pacific Islander American Vote (APIAVote), The Black Futures Lab, National Black Justice Coalition, Rock the Vote, Vote.org. VotoLatino.es, and When We All Vote, we aim to mobilize and inform communities around registration and the voting process, and offer educational resources to ensure that voters are ready to participate in the 2024 elections. #SMGImpact

Last Saturday, artists and employees from Sony Music Germany celebrated and demonstrated for love, diversity and human rights. üåà Sony Music Germany once again represented with its own truck at Berlin‚Äôs Christopher Street Day (CSD), with almost 160 employees in attendance, including members from EYO (Embrace Yourself and Others), Sony Music Germany‚Äôs Talent Advisory Group for queer-identifying people and allies. Hundreds of thousands of people took part in the demonstration in Berlin, uniting the slogan ‚ÄúOnly Strong Together - For Democracy and Diversity.‚Äù Among other activities, Sony Music also hosted a fair booth at Sticks & Stones, Europe's largest LGBTQIA+ job and career fair, at the beginning of the month. For more about how our Sony Music Germany has been celebrating Pride, visit: https://lnkd.in/exV79yem #LifeatSonyMusic #Pride

Black musicians have provided the soundtrack for many significant cultural movements, even if not always recognized for it. At Sony Music Group, we believe it's crucial to recognize the profound influence of Black contributors and the undeniable Blackness throughout the spectrum of musical expression. This past month we‚Äôve celebrated #BlackMusicMonth by hosting a variety of events and discussions with our employees highlighting the extensive impact Black artists have had across various genres. #BlackMusicMonth #LifeatSonyMusic (Note: Reposted with updated branding.)

This Pride Month, we‚Äôve been celebrating the LGBTQ+ community and underscoring our commitment to creating an environment where every person can be authentic and live out loud. This year, we challenge ourselves to reimagine what it means to be an ally to our artists, songwriters, employees, and fans around the world who are part of this multifaceted and vibrant community. Sony Music employees have participated in Pride-themed discussions, luncheons, workout classes, and are marching in Pride Parades around the world! #PrideMonth #LifeatSonyMusic Cara Olson

Here‚Äôs how team Sony celebrated the #SonyGlobalSocialJusticeFund four-year anniversary üåü Team members from across all Sony companies came together in LA to honor the collective achievements of the Fund and its partners with a special unveiling of this year‚Äôs Global Social Justice Fund Impact Report. The celebration was also an opportunity for Fund partners to meet each other, and for everyone to learn about the progress we‚Äôve made together. #SMGImpact Read the full report here: https://lnkd.in/e2HifpAX

In June 2020, the Sony Global Social Justice Fund (GSJF) was created. To commemorate its four-year anniversary, we‚Äôve created a report spotlighting some of our partners and their stories to show the profound power of individuals to effect change. Click here to read our full Global Social Justice Fund Impact Report: https://lnkd.in/e2HifpAX #SMGImpact #SonyGlobalSocialJusticeFund

Black Music can‚Äôt be defined by a single genre, for its impact often creates and shapes the foundation for genres such as hip-hop, jazz, pop, country, and more. So, this Black Music Month, Sony Music Group proudly honors the pioneering artistic contributions of the Black artists, songwriters, and musicians shaping our industry. Sony Music Group is embracing a singular, unifying theme for every heritage acknowledgement and celebration in 2024: Reimagining CommUNITY. Inspired by the art we create, music can help us strengthen our connections to the people and cultures around us, so everyone can belong and thrive.

This June, Sony Music Group proudly celebrates Pride Month. As we honor the innovative creativity and indelible impact of LGBTQ+ identifying people, we also challenge ourselves to reimagine what it means to be an ally to everyone part of this multifaceted and vibrant community. Sony Music Group is embracing a singular, unifying theme for every heritage acknowledgement and celebration in 2024: Reimagining CommUNITY. Inspired by the art we create, music can help us strengthen our connections to the people and cultures around us, so everyone can belong and thrive.

The Sony Music Group Global Impact Report‚Äînow in its third iteration‚Äîserves as a recurring opportunity for all of us at Sony Music Group to reflect on the progress we‚Äôve made. Read the latest report here: https://lnkd.in/ejwemahx
